amendment.description: Amendment sought to provide that nothing in the bill may be construed to abridge the freedoms found in the First Amendment to the Constitution, specifically the freedom of speech or of the press, or the right of people to peaceably assemble and to petition the government for a redress of grievances.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 32 printed in the Congressional Record to state that nothing in the bill may be construed to abridge First Amendment rights, specifically the freedoms of speech and the press, the right to peaceably assemble and the right to petition the government for a redress of grievances.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Hyde amendment (A004) Failed by recorded vote: 188 - 237, 1 Present (Roll no. 22).
